title: To Laners, from a Jungler
body:
Let me first say that I enjoy jungling. But I'd enjoy it more if I wasn't consistently 1-3 levels behind the solo laners (thanks Riot), and if I wasn't frequently used as a scapegoat when people lose their lane. So let me try to explain some things from a jungler's perspective:

1. The jungler is there to help you do your job; the jungler is _not_ there to do your job for you. When you mess up, **it's not the jungler's fault.**

2. If you want a gank, **do not push your lane.** The chances of a successful gank are near-zero when the enemy laner can sit and farm from under their tower. The further away they are from their tower, the more likely a gank is to succeed.

3. When the jungler ganks, **they need your help** to secure the kill. If you space out and didn't notice the jungler coming in for a gank, don't blame the jungler when the enemy laner lives.

4. The jungler needs to farm, just like everyone else. Do you think a jungler is going to do well when they spend the first 7 minutes stuck at level 4 with no items because their teammates ask them to babysit their lanes constantly? A little patience goes a long way towards a successful gank.

5. If you're losing your lane, your jungler can only do so much to help. Ganking a losing lane is risky at best when the opposing laner has a level/gold advantage, and you're not going to make it any easier by continuing to feed. Stay alive, don't take risks, and don't expect your jungler to babysit your lane 24/7. The jungler has other things to do, like taking objectives and helping the other lanes snowball so your team can actually gain the upper hand.

And in conclusion, let me say this one more time: The jungler is there to help you do your job, **not** do it for you. Instead of blaming the jungler when you overextend and give up first blood, why not acknowledge your own misplays and focus on winning instead of pointing fingers to try and cover your ass? Starting an argument with your jungler will only serve to put everyone on tilt, and it severely hurts your team's chances of winning. Teamwork wins games, not arguments or egos.

Did I say I was a macro god? I just hate the frequency with which I get blamed for other people's failures. I've had several teammates that lose their lane fair and square and feed all game (without any ganks from the enemy jungler, mind you; they just got outplayed by the enemy laner), but instantly point fingers at me every time they die.

If you're losing your lane, don't play aggressive. If you mess up, it's your fault, not the jungler's. This is not rocket science.

When I'm losing lane, ping for a gank about 2 times and try to be patient when the enemy lane is constantly pushed up to my turret, and you still haven't ganked for a good 3 minutes now, I'm going to be put on tilt a little bit. You AREN'T responsible for me winning the matchup, however, YOU ARE responsible for ganking the easiest lane to gank if your top NEEDS help.
